item.title: Pull Back in Differential Geometry
item.description: Overview We define the pullback on a differential manifold. If differential manifolds are complex, one can think of $M = \mathbb{R}^{m}$ and $N = \mathbb{R}^{n}$. Definition1 Given two differential manifolds $M, N$ and a differentiable function $f : M \to N$, we can consider a function $f^{\ast}$ that maps $N$’s $k$-forms to $M$’s $k$-forms. Let $\omega$ be a $k$-form on the manifold $N$, then a $k$-form $f^{\ast}\omega$ on the manifold
